Compiled models for different tasks.¶

futils.compiled_models.dice_coef_mean(y_true, y_pred)[source]¶

Returns the product of dice coefficient for each class it assumes channel 0 as background

TODOChoose channel (and axis) of background

Choose other merge methods (sum,avg,etc)

futils.compiled_models.dice_coef_prod(y_true, y_pred)[source]¶

completely same with dice_coef but cahieved with different operations

TODOChoose channel (and axis) of background

Choose other merge methods (sum,avg,etc)

futils.compiled_models.dice_coef_weight_pow(y_true, y_pred)[source]¶

this dice is designed to increase the ratio of class which include smaller area, by the function: K.pow(ratio_y_pred + 0.001, -1.0) hope this can make the model pay more attention to the small classes like the right middle lobe

TODOChoose channel (and axis) of background

Choose other merge methods (sum,avg,etc)

futils.compiled_models.dice_coef_weight_sub(y_true, y_pred)[source]¶

Returns the product of dice coefficient for each class this dice is designed to increase the ratio of class which include smaller area, by the function: ratio_y_pred = 1.0 - ratio_y_pred) hope this can make the model pay more attention to the small classes like the right middle lobe can be used but not powerful as power weights

TODOChoose channel (and axis) of background

Choose other merge methods (sum,avg,etc)

futils.compiled_models.intro(inputs, nf, bn)[source]¶

introduction convolution + PReLU (+ batch_normalization).

Parameters

  • inputs -- data from last output

  • nf -- number of filters (or feature maps)

  • bn -- if batch normalization

Returns

convolution results

futils.compiled_models.load_cp_models(model_names, nch=1, lr=0.0001, nf=16, bn=1, dr=1, ds=2, aux=0.5, net_type='v')[source]¶

load compiled models.

Parameters

  • model_names -- a list of model names

  • nch -- number of input image channel

  • lr -- learning rate

  • nf -- number of basic filters (or feature maps)

  • bn -- if batch normalization

  • dr -- if dropout

  • ds -- number of deep supervision

  • aux -- if auxilary task

  • net_type -- 'v' means 'V-Net', 'u' means 'U-Net'

Returns

a list of compiled models

futils.compiled_models.up_trans(input1, nf, nconvs, bn, dr, ty='v', input2=None, name='block')[source]¶

up transform convolution.

Parameters

  • input1 -- output from last layer

  • nf -- number of filters (or feature maps)

  • nconvs -- number of convolution operations

  • bn -- if batch normalization

  • dr -- if dropout

  • ty -- model type, 'v' means V-Net, 'u' means 'U-Net'

  • input2 -- second input, necessary for merge results from short connection

  • name -- block name

Returns

convolution results

util¶

Possible functions on loading, saving, processing itk files.¶

Created on Tue Apr 4 09:35:14 2017 @author: fferreira and Jingnan

futils.util.load_itk(filename)[source]¶
Parameters

filename -- absolute file path

Returns

ct, origin, spacing, all of them has coordinate (z,y,x) if filename exists. Otherwise, 3 empty list.

futils.util.load_nrrd(filename)[source]¶

Load .nrrd file using package nrrd. Can be replaced by function load_itk().

Parameters

filename -- absolute file path

Returns

array of ct, origin and spacing with shape (z, y, x)

futils.util.normalize(image, min_=- 1000.0, max_=400.0)[source]¶

Set the values to [0~1].

Parameters

  • image -- image array

  • min -- bottom

  • max -- top

Returns

convert ct scan to 0~1

futils.util.sample_scan(scan, sz=128, z_length=64, pivot_axis=1, scale_axis=0, order=0)[source]¶

Downscale scan only in slicing direction with nearest interpolation

futils.util.save_itk(filename, scan, origin, spacing, dtype='int16')[source]¶

Save a array to itk file.

Parameters

  • filename -- saved file name, a string.

  • scan -- scan array, shape(z, y, x)

  • origin -- origin of itk file, shape (z, y, x)

  • spacing -- spacing of itk file, shape (z, y, x)

  • dtype -- 'int16' default

Returns

None

vpatch¶

patch, deconstruct and reconstruct ct array.¶

Created on May 06 14:57:47 2020 @author: fferreira and Jingnan

futils.vpatch.deconstruct_patch(scan, patch_shape=64, 128, 128, stride=0.25)[source]¶

deconstruct a ct to a batch of patches.

Parameters

  • scan -- a ct array which need to be deconstructed to (overlapped) patches. shape (z, x, y, chn)

  • patch_shape -- shape (z, x, y)

  • stride -- overlap ratio along each axil. float between 0~1 means the same overlap ratio along all axils;1 means no overlap, a list means the corresponding different overlap ratio along different axils.

Returns

a batch of patches, shape (nb_ptches, z, x, y, chn)

futils.vpatch.random_patch(scan, gt_scan=None, aux_scan=None, patch_shape=64, 128, 128, p_middle=None)[source]¶

get ramdom patches from the given ct.

Parameters

  • scan -- one ct scan array, dimensions: 4, shape order: (z, x, y, chn) todo: check the shape order

  • gt_scan -- ground truth, binary masks of object, shape order: (z, x, y, 2)

  • aux_scan -- auxiliary scan, binary boundary of object, shape order: (z, x, y, 2)

  • patch_shape -- patch shape, shape order: (z, x, y) todo: check the shape order

  • p_middle -- float number between 0~1, probability of patches in the middle parts of ct scan

Returns

one patch of ct scan (with one patch of gdth and aux if gdth and aux are not None), dimensions: 4,shape oreders are the same as their correspoonding input scans

futils.vpatch.reconstruct_patch(scan, original_shape=128, 256, 256, stride=0.25)[source]¶

reconstruct a ct from a batch of patches.

Parameters

  • scan -- a batch of patches array, shape(nb, z, x, y, chn)

  • original_shape -- shape of original ct scan, shape (z, x, y)

  • stride -- overlap ratio on each axil

Returns

a ct with original shape (z, x, y)
